definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: The electrician joined the wires up.
Trolleybuses are collected to electric wires.
The wire snapped at the wall plug and the light fused.
sentences.chinese: 牆上插座的電線短路燒斷了保險絲，電燈跟着滅了。

sentences.english: He rigged up all the electric wires rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 他把所有的電線迅速地安裝妥當。

sentences.english: Convenient cable organizer keeps cables tangle-free.
sentences.chinese: 方便的電纜電線纏結組織者保持免費。

sentences.english: his head thrown back against a telephone pole.
sentences.chinese: 他在睡覺，他的頭後仰靠在電線杆上。

sentences.english: Virgin Media has started trials to deliver fibre-optic high-speed broadband over telegraph poles.
sentences.chinese: 維珍傳媒已開始試驗使用電線杆架設高速光纖寬帶。

sentences.english: For instance, rubber was used to insulate electrical wires.
sentences.chinese: 舉例說，橡膠用來使電線絕緣。

sentences.english: He answered, "Yes Sir, but the Goddamned wire has to be fixed".
sentences.chinese: 他回答，“對，長官，但這該死的電線不修不行”。

sentences.english: A much smaller power loss occurs in the cable when energy is transmitted at high voltage.
sentences.chinese: 用高壓輸送電能時，沿輸電線的功率損耗小得多。

sentences.english: The worker broke the circuit by disconnecting the wires.
sentences.chinese: 這名工人通過割斷電線切斷了電路。

sentences.english: The snake wound itself round the wires.
Get all the wires straightened out.
Barometer readings are plotted on a pressure chart.
sentences.chinese: 高壓輸電線斷落，造成大面積停電。

sentences.english: Usually wires are covered with plastic.
sentences.chinese: 電線外面通常包有一層塑料外殼。

sentences.english: He noticed the remains of a snake which was wound round the electric wire.
sentences.chinese: 他注意到一條纏繞在那根電線的蛇的遺蹟。

definition: to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
junk/items of no value/various bits and bobs
easily/without trouble/while one is at it/in passing/handy
